Literature Review: Immersed boundary methods (IBMs) have a rich history that spans over five decades, with the first conceptualization and implementation dating back to the early 1960s. Despite the limitations of early computers, researchers continued to explore and refine the techniques, laying the groundwork for their widespread adoption in the new millennium. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the historical perspective and future outlook of IBMs, highlighting their advantages, limitations, and potential applications in complex flow problems.
